oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Scenes in the Mining Regions of Tenn.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Singleton & McFarland, Photographers, 257 Gay Street, Knoxville, Tenn.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Back of photograph. Scenes in the Mining Regions of Tenn. From original negatives by Singleton & McFarland, Photographers, 257 Gay Street, Knoxville, TN’. List on back: photographs of ‘Groups we have taken at Briceville, Coal Creek, Fort Anderson and Camp Carnes. Number circled on back is 671: Queen City Guards on Walden’s Ridge.’ Photograph shows young men in military uniform seated and standing outdoors, holding rifles. East Tennessee conflict between coal miners and the convict-lease system was in 1891. The state militia was called in by the Governor.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mining; Military personnel; Military uniforms; Rifles; Coal mining;
